metaDescription: Premium 3-bedroom bungalow in San Miguel de Salinas. €251,600. Perfect retirement home with established expat community, year-round sunshine, and excellent healthcare.
heroIntro:
Welcome to your peaceful retirement haven on Costa Blanca. This charming 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom bungalow in San Miguel de Salinas offers the relaxed lifestyle you've been dreaming about, without the premium price tag. At €251,600—40% less expensive than comparable properties on Spanish islands—this home delivers outstanding value for discerning buyers seeking quality living in a established international community.

San Miguel de Salinas has become a sanctuary for retirees from across Europe who value easy living, reliable healthcare, and genuine friendships with like-minded expats. This property sits in a well-established neighborhood where English is widely spoken, and day-to-day life flows at a comfortable pace. With 75 square meters of thoughtfully designed living space on a 59-square-meter plot, every room serves a purpose, eliminating unnecessary maintenance while maximizing comfort.

Imagine waking each morning to year-round sunshine, spending afternoons exploring pristine Blue Flag beaches just 20 minutes away, or enjoying a round of golf at one of several championship courses nearby. Your healthcare needs are covered by English-speaking doctors, modern medical facilities are within 30 minutes, and the welcoming expat community ensures you'll never feel isolated. This is where life simplifies, friendships deepen, and retirement becomes the best chapter of your life.
areaSection: San Miguel de Salinas sits in the heart of Alicante province, just 35 kilometers south of Alicante city. Despite its convenient location, the town maintains a peaceful, unhurried character that appeals strongly to retirees. The area enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually, with average temperatures ranging from 16°C in winter to 32°C in summer—ideal for those seeking to escape harsh northern climates. The town itself is compact and walkable, surrounded by the natural beauty of the Lagoons of Torrevieja Natural Park. Located between the resort towns of Torrevieja and Orihuela, San Miguel de Salinas offers the perfect balance: close enough to amenities and services, yet far enough removed from crowded tourist zones to maintain its authentic, residential character.
lifestyleSection: Life in San Miguel de Salinas centers on community, good food, and outdoor activities. Your daily routine might include a morning coffee at a local café where English-speaking expats gather, followed by shopping at Mercadona or exploring the weekly local market for fresh produce. Lunch is leisurely—as it should be—with numerous restaurants and bars within walking distance serving both Spanish cuisine and international favorites. The established expat community means you'll find book clubs, bridge groups, golf outings, and social events throughout the week. Healthcare is accessible and reassuring, with English-speaking doctors and modern clinics nearby. Beaches at Torrevieja, just 20 minutes away, offer swimming, coastal walks, and seafood restaurants. Your new life here balances structure with spontaneity: organized activities with your friends, quiet mornings on your terrace, and the freedom to explore the stunning Alicante coastline whenever you wish.
investmentSection: Beyond a personal residence, this property represents sound financial thinking. San Miguel de Salinas property prices have increased 8% year-on-year, reflecting growing demand from international buyers seeking value and quality of life. The rental market is strong—similar properties command approximately €800 per week during peak season, translating to €41,600 annually if you choose to generate income. At €3,355 per square meter, this property is priced 40% below comparable homes on Spanish islands, offering exceptional value. The area continues to attract retirees and families seeking affordable Mediterranean living, ensuring sustained demand. Whether you purchase as a primary residence or investment asset, location fundamentals remain solid with infrastructure improvements ongoing and the expat community continuing to grow.
conclusion: This bungalow represents more than a property purchase—it's an investment in your retirement lifestyle. San Miguel de Salinas welcomes you into an established community where English is spoken, healthcare is reliable, and daily life unfolds at a comfortable pace. At €251,600, you're acquiring a modern, well-maintained home in a location that consistently outperforms expectations for quality of life, value, and personal satisfaction. The Mediterranean climate, proximity to beaches and golf, and thriving expat social scene ensure your retirement becomes active, connected, and genuinely fulfilling. Ready to explore this opportunity further? Contact us via WhatsApp for personalized property tours, financing discussions, or answers to your specific questions. Your new chapter awaits in the Spanish sunshine.

healthcare.text: Healthcare in San Miguel de Salinas is reliable, modern, and accessible. The Torrevieja Hospital, located just 18 kilometers away, is a major private medical facility offering specialized services and English-speaking doctors. Multiple private clinics throughout the town provide general medical care, dental services, and specialist consultations. Many physicians in the area specifically serve the international community and are accustomed to speaking English with foreign patients. Emergency services are well-established, and healthcare costs remain significantly lower than in Northern Europe, whether you use private insurance or the Spanish public system. For retirees, the availability of healthcare professionals familiar with treating expat populations provides peace of mind.

Shopping centers in Torrevieja, 20 kilometers distant, provide department stores, clothing retailers, and dining options for larger shopping excursions. Prices remain reasonable compared to Northern Europe, particularly for fresh produce and local products.

Many retirees appreciate owning a car for leisure activities—beach visits, golf outings, and exploring the region.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om vastgoed te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains an excellent property market. The region offers year-round sunshine, established infrastructure, a thriving international community, and property values appreciating at 8% annually. San Miguel de Salinas specifically attracts retirees and families seeking authentic Mediterranean living without excessive tourism. The combination of lifestyle quality, healthcare access, and value for money makes it particularly attractive for retirement property purchases.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders vastgoed kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign nationals can freely purchase property in Spain without restrictions. No visa is required simply to buy property. Most international buyers use NIE (Número de Identidad de Extranjero) numbers for the transaction and subsequent tax purposes. The purchase process typically takes 4-6 weeks after the offer is accepted. Spanish legal frameworks protect foreign property owners equally with Spanish citizens.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van het kopen van vastgoed in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Beyond the property purchase price, expect additional costs totaling approximately 8-12% of the purchase price. These include: property transfer tax (6-8%), notary fees (0.5-1%), land registry fees (0.1%), and legal fees (1-2%). No VAT applies to secondary property sales. These costs are standard and transparent, allowing you to budget accurately for your purchase.

faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca geschikt voor gepensioneerden?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca is exceptional for retirees. The region offers year-round Mediterranean climate eliminating harsh winters, comprehensive healthcare with English-speaking doctors, thriving expat communities, abundant social activities, affordable cost of living, and excellent value for property investment. San Miguel de Salinas specifically provides peaceful living with immediate access to beaches, golf, restaurants, and cultural activities—ideal for active retirement lifestyles.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten van levensonderhoud aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is significantly lower than Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a retired couple typically range from €1,200-€1,800, including housing costs. Groceries, utilities, dining out, and healthcare are substantially cheaper than UK, Germany, or Scandinavia. Many retirees report their pensions stretch further in Spain while maintaining—or improving—their quality of life. Property, energy, and food costs remain particularly affordable.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes, many Spanish banks offer mortgages to foreign nationals, typically providing 70-80% loan-to-value financing for primary residences. Interest rates remain competitive (currently 3-4%). You'll need a Spanish NIE number, proof of income, and typically a 20-30% deposit. Banco Sabadell, BBVA, and other major lenders actively serve international buyers. Many foreign buyers find Spanish mortgages attractive compared to refinancing in their home countries.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerendgoedbelasting in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Spanish property taxes vary by region. Annual property tax (IBI) on this property typically costs €200-€300 yearly. Rental income is taxed at progressive rates if you generate rental revenue. Non-resident property owners pay additional annual non-resident tax (approximately 19% on theoretical rental value), though this can be minimized through residency. Costs remain lower than most Northern European countries for equivalent properties.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 300 days of sunshine annually. Summer temperatures average 32°C (May-September), while winters are mild at 16°C (December-February). Rainfall is minimal, concentrated primarily in autumn and spring. The Costa Blanca consistently ranks among Spain's sunniest regions, making it ideal for retirees seeking to escape harsh northern winters while avoiding extreme summer heat typical of inland regions.

faqs.question: Hoe ver is de Costa Blanca van Nederland?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport, just 48 kilometers from this property, operates direct flights to London, Manchester, Edinburgh, and other UK cities. Flight times are typically 2-2.5 hours. Budget airlines like Ryanair and easyJet offer regular service, making visits to family and friends straightforward and affordable. Many retirees enjoy easy accessibility to the UK without permanent commitment to northern climates.
